Fictional Multipurpose AA Reticle, by Clonycommander

A pretty standard aim reticle for AA vehicles (and even other ground units, if you want).
Works wonderfully on twin/quad mounted AAs, specialy the mid-tier ones.

Features:
-Wide center reticle, equivalent of the beatzone of most guns, alowing for a better head-on shooting.
-Leading ranges on multiples of 5x100m, with angled bars, for more precise leadings.
-Ragefinder and elevation are inside boxes far from the main sight, for quick aquisition without sightblocking.
-Fixed straight bars on the horizon line, for more control during aiming

This is my attempt at rendering the VK-3 collimator gunsight used by the ZSU-57-2. The VK-3 is actually part of a larger automatic anti-aircraft fire control system, but can be used as a back-up optical sight in manual mode.

There isn't much technical documentation on the ZSU-57-2 online, only this CIA document: https://www.cia.gov/library/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP80T00246A063900520001-5.pdf

#zsu_57_2 #zsu #sight #crosshair #historical

(Turn on crosshair lighting if you want it to look more like a collimator sight)

This is the realistic sight for the M1987A4 cannon with French origin that is found in the M3 halftrack. The sight was meant for AP between 0 and 3000 meters and for APCBC can be used accurately up to 1500 meters. The HE and smoke shells have to be used as a howitzer and use the binos, for the scope is not prepared for them and not only are they very slow, but their effective range was between 7000 and 8500 meters, which is well away from the scope.

Japanese Tank Sight, slightly modernized due to how range adjustments work in the game - should work with any shell type;

1. Take the vehicle for a Test Drive, then go to Options → Main → Tank battle settings.
2. In the heading “Use alternative sight grid”, select “Add a grid sight”.
3. In the UserSights folder in the game directory, a folder will be created with the name of the selected vehicle and a BLK file (sight_1), which is an example of a standard sight.
3. Copy this sight into the created folder with the vehicle name.
4. Restart the game.
5. Select the sight for the tank from Options

Look at the Halo universe tank, UNSC Scorpion.

Installation instructions:

1. Download and unzip the .zip file
2. Create the folder of the tank optics that you want to change
3. Copy and re-stock the sight file
4. If the optics are not changed, press the Alt + F9 keys

Enjoy the look
